verses.text_plain: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
verses.verse_html: 1As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

verses.text_plain: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
verses.verse_html: 2As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

verses.text_plain: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.
verses.verse_html: 3A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.

verses.text_plain: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
verses.verse_html: 4Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

verses.text_plain: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
verses.verse_html:
5Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit. ▼
▼ conceit: Heb. eyes

verses.text_plain: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
verses.verse_html:
6He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage. ▼
▼ damage: or, violence

verses.text_plain: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.verse_html:
7The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools. ▼
▼ are…: Heb. are lifted up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ are…: Heb. are lifted up

verses.text_plain: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
verses.verse_html:
8As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool. ▼
▼ bindeth…: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones

footnotes.body_text: ▼ bindeth…: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones
footnotes.body_html: ▼ bindeth…: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones

verses.text_plain: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.verse_html: 9As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

verses.text_plain: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
verses.verse_html:
10The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors. ▼
▼ The great…: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors

footnotes.body_text: ▼ The great…: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors
footnotes.body_html: ▼ The great…: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors

verses.text_plain: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
verses.verse_html:
11As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly. ▼
▼ returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly

footnotes.body_text: ▼ returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly

verses.text_plain: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
verses.verse_html: 12Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

verses.text_plain: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
verses.verse_html: 13The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

verses.text_plain: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
verses.verse_html: 14As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

verses.text_plain: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
verses.verse_html:
15The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth. ▼
▼ it grieveth…: or, he is weary

footnotes.body_text: ▼ it grieveth…: or, he is weary
footnotes.body_html: ▼ it grieveth…: or, he is weary

verses.text_plain: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
verses.verse_html: 16The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

verses.text_plain: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
verses.verse_html:
17He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears. ▼
▼ meddleth: or, is enraged

footnotes.body_html: ▼ meddleth: or, is enraged

verses.text_plain: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
verses.verse_html:
18As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death, ▼
▼ firebrands: Heb. flames, or, sparks

footnotes.body_html: ▼ firebrands: Heb. flames, or, sparks

verses.text_plain: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
verses.verse_html: 19So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

verses.text_plain: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
verses.verse_html:
20Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth. ▼
▼ Where no…: Heb. Without wood
 , ▼
▼ talebearer: or, whisperer
 , ▼
▼ ceaseth: Heb. is silent

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Where no…: Heb. Without wood
▼ ceaseth: Heb. is silent

verses.text_plain: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
verses.verse_html: 21As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

verses.text_plain: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.verse_html:
22The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly. ▼
▼ innermost…: Heb. chambers

verses.text_plain: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
verses.verse_html: 23Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

verses.text_plain: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
verses.verse_html:
24He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him; ▼
▼ dissembleth: or, is known

footnotes.body_html: ▼ dissembleth: or, is known

verses.text_plain: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
verses.verse_html:
25When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart. ▼
▼ speaketh…: Heb. maketh his voice gracious

footnotes.body_text: ▼ speaketh…: Heb. maketh his voice gracious
footnotes.body_html: ▼ speaketh…: Heb. maketh his voice gracious

verses.text_plain: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
verses.verse_html:
26Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation. ▼
▼ by…: or, in secret

footnotes.body_html: ▼ by…: or, in secret

verses.text_plain: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
verses.verse_html: 27Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

verses.text_plain: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
verses.verse_html: 28A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
